intro: Impatiens violoides, commonly known as the purple impatiens, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from pale purple to deep violet. The plant typically grows as an annual or short-lived perennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its foliage consists of heart-shaped, glossy leaves that provide a striking contrast to the colorful blooms. Impatiens violoides is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens and as a bedding plant due to its attractive appearance and ease of care.
